intro: Cysticorydalis fedtschenkoana, commonly known as the Fedtschenko's rock cress, is a rare flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and alpine environments, where it has adapted to harsh climatic conditions. Its leaves are usually basal and rosette-like, and the flowers are white or pale yellow, often appearing in clusters. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
